issues.title: Reserve the publication of the transparency.json manifest in the .well-known folder
issues.author: nikiluk
issues.body:
Once the format of the transparency manifest is updated and aligned, it's important to make sure the file structure and naming is recognized by the community and everyone knows that the file called transparency.json is responsible for the transparency protocol disclosures and should be read/treated in a specific way.

```
Feature: standard placement for disclosures in the .well-known folder

Given the format of the transparency manifest is registered for `.well-known` folder
And the disclosure is correctly made
And the transparency.json is created
When the user places transparency.json into a .well-known folder
Then the file is automatically recognized there and  could be read by crawlers and bots
```

issues.title: Upload the OEL repository to GitHub
issues.author: nikiluk

issues.title: Add content blog article explaining what Disclosure is and how it relates to Transparency Manifest
issues.author: nikiluk

issues.title: Typical scenarios and templates for Disclosure submissions
issues.author: nikiluk
issues.body:
```
Feature: Disclosure Template

Given AI system provider is about to make the disclosure
When they select from one of the templates
Then fields get pre-filled
And it's clear which elements of the disclosure are required or optional
```

issues.title: Enhance Label accessibility with ARIA W3C Recommendation and other approaches
issues.author: nikiluk
issues.body:
Use best practices in WCAG2.1 to improve the SVG files of the label and their presentation within the OEL. 

This task requires updated label files to be shared on GitHub as they are not yet there, ask @nikiluk 

```
Feature: Accessible labels

Given the label that is displayed in the web interface, loading from label.openethics.ai
When the labels are accessed by the screen readers
Then their meaning should be clear
And the UI should be not only visible but audible
```

issues.title: Create disclosure schemas for families of "Generative AI" technologies such as Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), Conditional Variational Autoencoders (CVAEs), Attention Mechanisms, Transformer-based Models.
issues.author: dizzysunset
issues.body: This task is will help to extend the OETP disclosure schema and make it useful for wider set of applications.

comments.author: rxhith
comments.body: Can we get more details on the format in which the task has to be submitted. Also the details which are expected wrt OETP disclosure schema for the various models.

comments.author: nikiluk
comments.body:
Hi @rxhith this will be more of OETP/Label project and will not have to do with this repository https://github.com/OpenEthicsAI/OETP

You can get more information and ask more specific questions after reading the OETP document as well as to checking the format of the existing shema. You can get one by submitting an example disclosure here https://openethics.ai/label/generate/

comments.author: aan2907
comments.body: Hi @nikiluk we are not sure what disclosure schema means. In what format are we supposed to create the schema? We have researched about Generative AI technologies but we are not sure how to go from there. We would really appreciate any help in guiding us to create the disclosure schema.

comments.author: nikiluk
comments.body:
> Hi @nikiluk we are not sure what disclosure schema means. In what format are we supposed to create the schema? We have researched about Generative AI technologies but we are not sure how to go from there. We would really appreciate any help in guiding us to create the disclosure schema.

Hi, i see, as I mentioned above, you can read about the disclosure principles in the OETP repository and on the IETF page of I-D of the Open Ethics Transparency Protocol.

The transparency manifest file that contains the disclosure could be generated on the Open Ethics website (see link in my previous comment), I invite you to try filling out the form and getting the file that includes the disclosure alongside the Open Ethics Label HTML code. Disclosure is a JSON file.

The example of "empty" disclosure is also here https://github.com/OpenEthicsAI/OETP/blob/main/examples/basic%20disclosure/oetp.json

With the same idea as in the Data Passport Schema (https://openethics.ai/schema/oedp.passport.schema.json), the schema for the disclosure will provide the rules for the fields of the Disclosure, e.g. what's optional, what's required, which formats/enums/strings/objects etc. 

To learn more about JSON schemas as a standardization approach you can visit https://json-schema.org/

comments.author: nikiluk
comments.body: @aan2907 there was a question about the disclosure and the current schema, please see a more detailed answer here https://github.com/OpenEthicsAI/OETP/issues/23 with examples of the disclosure and the schema with the description is on https://openethics.ai/oetp/

issues.title: Reorganize OETP schema to be stored in the OETP repository and resolve conflicts related to the schema publication to the same schema folder
issues.author: nikiluk

comments.author: nikiluk
comments.body:
As a result of the reorganization:

- all Data Passport schemas are stored in the OEDP repository and are deployed to `https://openethics.ai/schema/oedp/`
- all Transparency Disclosure schemas are stored in OETP repository and are deployed to `https://openethics.ai/schema/oetp/`

The WIP on the new disclosure schema to be done here https://github.com/OpenEthicsAI/OETP/blob/main/schema/oetp.disclosure.schema-vNext.json

issues.title: Blog: Write an article on the EU AI Act transparency requirements & cross-check them with the transparency disclosure
issues.author: dizzysunset
issues.body: The article will showcase what the EU AI Act transparency requirements are & will cross-check them with what the Open Ethics Label offers as a solution, in order for the companies to see to which extent they can align to the EU AI Act by using our tool.

issues.title: Extend the IETF deadline and update the GitHub actions for submission of the I-D for the OETP
issues.author: nikiluk

issues.title: Map the regulatory requirements and future Disclosure elements for EU AI Act
issues.author: nikiluk
issues.body:
Open Ethics's mission is to develop standards that are interoperable and independent / invariant to the legal framework they are applied in.

Today, there are a number of available tools present and specific to certain legal frameworks. They are not focused on the technical but in a legal aspect and the judgment on how to work with them may often be subjective. We of course should study them too. 

Based on the above, the goal is to study commonalities and differences between the legal frameworks and based on them and the current technology lifecycle, to develop requirements for the elements of the disclosure that should be required or optional and thus cover different frameworks at the same time

This work aims to create a bridge between the legal and technical requirements and should help product owners with the frame that is agnostic to the legal requirement, free of the legal language, but factual and understandible for the one who disclose or consumes the disclosure at the same time. 

The short-term vision is to make sure multiple elements are mapped and matched across various legal guidelines and frameworks. Again, we're talking about transparency, engineering and safety decisions. 

The long-term vision that the final outcome will be reached iteratively, and 

first will allow filling in the disclosure and 
later will allow the unbiased cross-framework judgment to whether the product satisfies or not the given legal frame

This specific tasks focuses solely on the mapping of the requirements of the AI Act 
After its complete we will work on other frameworks, such as NIST
